title: Two-Dimensional Fe Oxide on Metallic Fe Nanoparticles Visualized by Atom-Resolved Secondary Electron Imaging
content: Adsorption of oxygen on metallic Fe nanoparticle and the resulting formation of surface oxide play a pivotal role in both heterogeneous catalysis and metallurgy. Nonetheless, there are limited techniques available to directly investigate the surface atom configurations of nanoparticles, particularly under realistic chemical environments. In this study, we introduce a novel microscopic approach, termed "atom-resolved secondary electron (SE) imaging technique" in an aberration-corrected scanning transmission electron microscope (STEM), to examine the complete oxygen coverage on metallic Fe nanoparticles and elucidate a atom configuration of surface oxide on the (111) surface of Î³-Fe nanoparticles. Employing atom-resolved secondary electron (SE) imaging and other microscopic tools, we reveal its single-layered honeycomb feature of 2D iron oxide over the metallic nanoparticles, providing an insightful understanding of the surface properties of iron materials.
